abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Recovery Project for St.
            Kitts and Nevis had the following ratings: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            and borrower performance were both satisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project: The Bank is well positioned to
            respond to similar emergency events in the future. The Bank
            can play an active role to assist countries in meeting
            established and evolving regulatory standards. There can be
            significant advantages to implementing multi-country
            programs through a regional entity. Regional procurement can
            bring important cost-benefits. Emergency projects benefit
            from close supervision.
